alert.note: Alert for Orange; Putnam; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 2:10PM EST until February 19 at 2:45PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Upton NY has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Passaic County in northeastern New Jersey... Northwestern Bergen County in northeastern New Jersey... Orange County in southeastern New York... Western Putnam County in southeastern New York... Rockland County in southeastern New York... * Until 245 PM EST. * At 209 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Highland to Andover, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Newburgh, Middletown, West Milford, Ringwood, Pompton Lakes, Suffern, Port Jervis, Monroe, Walden, West Point, Warwick, Goshen, Sloatsburg, Cold Spring and Howells. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
